alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 8:32PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jackson, northwestern Gadsden, southwestern Decatur and southern Seminole Counties through 915 PM EDT/815 PM CDT/... At 831 PM EDT/731 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Chattahoochee, or 13 miles south of Donalsonville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattahoochee, Sneads, Seminole State Park, Desser, Reynoldsville, Hardin Heights, Rosedale, Recovery, Haynes, Drakes Still, Jinks, Fairchild, River Junction and Lake Seminole. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT/800 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
